[[World Organization of the Scout Movement]]}} [[Image:Fire Ceremony in the Eitan Tribe of the Israeli Scouts Federation.JPG|thumb|250px|Fire ceremony, Shevet Eitan]] The '''Israel Boy and Girl Scouts Federation''' ({{lang-he|××ª×××××ª ××¦××¤×× ×××¦××¤××ª ×××©×¨××}}, ''Hit'ahdut HaTzofim VeHaTzofot BeYisrael'')[http://www.seascout.org/ships/international/Israel/ Sea Scouting: Sea Scouting in Israel] is [[Israel]]'s national Scouting organization, known in [[Hebrew]] as '''Tzofim'''. Some 90,000 boys and girls belong to Tzofim in Israel. ==History== The first Tzofim groups were founded in 1919. The Israeli Scouts movement became a member of the [[World Organization of the Scout Movement]] in 1951http://www.scout.org/en/around_the_world/countries/national_scout_organisations/some_statistics, after the establishment of the [[State of Israel]]. The first Girl Guide units were also established in 1919; the respective federation became a member of the [[World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts]] in 1963. In 2009, Tzofim celebrated its 90th birthday. To mark the occasion, Israel's Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] met members of Tzofim at his office, where he told stories of his youth in the Modi'in troop in [[Jerusalem]].{{cite web |last=Sredni |first=Yonatan |title=Scoutâs Honor? |month=June |year=2008 |work=Jewish Magazine |url=http://www.jewishmag.com/135mag/scouts_honor/scouts_honor.htm}} ==Principles== Tzofim is a non-political organization but upholds [[Zionist]] and [[Jewish]] values. Scout troops in Israel have always been coeducational. The federation in Israel consists of Jewish, [[Muslim]] [[Arab]], [[Christian Arab]], and [[Druze]] troops. Tzofim is open to everyone regardless of race, color, creed, or socio-economic standing. Israeli scouts come from all sectors of Israeli society. ==Structure== The Israel Scouts are divided into six regional hubs: Jerusalem, Central, Sharon, South, North, and Tzabar (North America and Western Europe). The scout troop is called a ''shevet'', or tribe. In the large cities, there may be several clubhouses in different neighborhoods. Most towns and kibbutzim also have scouts dens. ==Programs== There are two advanced scouting programs: The [[Wood Badge]], held every 4 years for adult scouts, and the Aryeh Croch Israeli Scouting Badge, held annually for 11th and 12th grade scouts. Most of the federation's programs and activities are held in the Scouts Ranch in the north of Israel. Tzofim runs a special project for children with physical and mental disabilities called ''Broshim'' (''Evergreens''). Tzofim maintains an active partnership with the German [[Verband Christlicher Pfadfinderinnen und Pfadfinder]], including exchange visits by leadership delegations and international events. ==Member organizations== [[File:Hebrew Scouts.jpg|thumb|100px|Emblem of the Hebrew Scouts Movement in Israel]] [[File:Catholic Scout Association in Israel.png|thumb|100px|Emblem of the Catholic Scout Association in Israel]] [[File:Israel Druze Boy and Girl Scout Association.png|thumb|100px|Emblem of the Druze Scouts Association]] [[File:Israel Greek Orthodox Scouts Association.png|thumb|100px|Emblem of the Greek Orthodox Scout Association]] The members of the federation are:[http://www.zofim.org.il/magazin_item.asp?item_id=48528124681&troop_id=274763776 The Israel Boy & Girl Scouts Federation] Hebrew Scouts website * [[Hebrew Scouts Movement in Israel]] - 60,000 members * [[Arab School Scouts Association]] - 13,000 members * [[Arab and Druze Scouts Movement]], which includes: ** Israel Arab Scouts Association - 2,000 members ** Catholic Scout Association in Israel - 3,000 members ** Israel Druze Scouts Association - 5,000 members ** Christian Orthodox Scout Association - 2,500 members ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.zofim.org.il/ The Hebrew Scouts Movement in Israel] (Hebrew) * [http://www.israelscouts.org/ Friends of Israel Scouts, Inc. - Tzofim] * [http://www.csaii.org/en/ Catholic Scout Association in Israel] * [http://www.scout-orthodox.org/site/default.asp?lang=EN Christian Orthodox Scout Association] {{-}} {{WOSM|european}} {{WAGGGS|europe}} [[Category:Scouting and Guiding in Israel| ]] [[Category:Organizations based in Israel]] [[Category:WAGGGS member organizations]] [[Category:WOSM member organizations]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1919]] [[he:××ª×××××ª ××¦××¤×× ×××¦××¤××ª ×××©×¨××]] [[ru:Ð¤ÐµÐ´ÐµÑÐ°ÑÐ¸Ñ ÑÐºÐ°ÑÑÐ¾Ð² ÐÐ·ÑÐ°Ð¸Ð»Ñ]]
